title: Figma's 8 Essential Tips Empower Designers to Build Scalable Branded Templates in Buzz

paragraphs.content: Figma Buzz, now in open beta, allows designers to publish responsive templates connected to design systems for marketing teams to create on-brand assets like social posts and ads. The official Figma blog details **8 tips** for building these templates, focusing on modularity and flexibility to prevent guideline violations during edits.Key practices include using auto layout for dynamic spacing and separating text layers for bulk CSV imports.

paragraphs.content: These tips emphasize renaming layers descriptively, such as “Event Title” or “Date of Event (e.g. July 10, 2025),” to guide users and ensure consistency.Component variants enable swaps for logos or icons without manual redesigns, while organized file naming boosts discoverability in Buzz's grid view.Recent updates add configurable properties for layout toggles like Instagram versus LinkedIn formats.

sections.title: Mastering Auto Layout and Layer Separation for Responsive Templates

paragraphs.content: Auto layout ensures elements like buttons and text maintain proper spacing even with varying content lengths, such as extended headlines.Designers should isolate text layers by font, size, or style to support Bulk Create features, avoiding formatting disruptions during data imports.Descriptive renaming with examples clarifies input expectations, promoting user consistency across assets.

paragraphs.content: Strategic locking of brand elements like logos preserves integrity while leaving body text and CTAs editable.Testing templates with real content validates responsiveness before publishing.Publishing follows simple steps: design in Buzz or paste from Figma Design, add details like thumbnails, and share via the template picker.

sections.title: Leveraging Variants and Buzz Features for Team Collaboration

paragraphs.content: Component variants consolidate options like horizontal or vertical logos into one set, accessible via swap tools for quick selections.Buzz's focused editing mode restricts changes to content only, locking layouts to enforce brand standards.Non-designers benefit from intuitive panels for text, images, and variant swaps, with pink outlines signaling guidelines.

paragraphs.content: Configurable templates via design system properties allow toggles for colors, sizes, or booleans like logo visibility.Plugins support asset management and video trimming, enhancing scalability for campaigns.Future inclusion in all seats will broaden access, reducing design review needs while maintaining consistency.
